tourBios.intlVics: (3) 2008 Abierto de Colombia in Bogota, Colombia [Colombia]. 2009 Máster Profesional in Bogota, Colombia [Colombia]. 2010 Woodcreek Classic [NGA].
tourBios.curYrHigh: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts. Best finish was a T18 at the Utah Championship in August.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 5 in the Order of Merit to join “Los Cinco” who earned Web.com Tour status for the 2014 season…Collected a victory, three top-3 finishes and four top-10 finishes in 14 starts this season…Making his second start of the season and his tenth Tour start overall, he went on to win the TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open at Atlas CC in Guadalajara, Mexico in March. Shot 66, 69, 74 and 67 to win at 8-under par 276. Had led the tournament for the first 36 holes and entered the final round trailing Oscar Serna by one. Made eagle on 15 and birdie on 18 to defeat José de Jesús Rodríguez by one. At the time, the $27,000 check helped him move into the second spot of the Order of Merit…Lost a sudden death playoff for the title of the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic presented by Avianca in October. Was defeated by José de Jesús Rodríguez after making a bogey on the second playoff hole in Bogota's San Andrés GC's par-three No. 9. Held the tournament's 36-hole lead after carding a 64 in the second round and had the chance of winning in the 72nd hole, but missed a five footer for birdie to finish tied with Rodríguez at 14-under par…Finished T3 at the Mundo Maya Open in Merida, Mexico, where he held the tournament lead for the first 36 holes in May…Finished T11 at the Puerto Rico Classic, an event he led following an opening round of 65 in October…Earned his Tour card through a Regional Exemption awarded to the Colombian Golf Federation…Made four cuts in five Web.com Tour starts to finish 106th on the Money List. His best Web.com Tour finishes were T7 at the Colombia Championship and T16 at the Cox Classic.

2012: In May he suffered a fracture of his fourth metacarpal in his right hand that keep him off the golf course for three months, a factor that limited his play during the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica…Had two top-25 finishes and made six cuts in eight starts to finish 58th on the Order of Merit…His best finish was T14 at the Lexus Peru Open in November…Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica full exempt status by finishing second in a local qualifier organized by the Colombian Golf Federation in August…His best finish in two Web.com Tour starts was T33 at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship.

2011: Represented Colombia at the 2011 OMEGA Mission Hills World Cup in China, with his brother, Camilo, as his partner, with the duo finishing T23…Made two cuts in four Web.com Tour starts, with a T19 finish at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open as his best…Missed the cut at the Puerto Rico in his only PGA TOUR start this season…Had a T38 finish at the European Tour's Iskandar Johor Open.

2010: Won the Woodcreek Classic on the NGA Hooters Tour…Made three cuts on eleven Web.com Tour starts, with a sixth place finish at the Moonah Classic in Australia as his best…T45 at the Puerto Rico Open in his only cut made in two PGA TOUR starts. 

2009: Held off his countryman and former PGA TOUR member Eduardo Herrera to win the Máster Profesional in Colombia by two shots at the Club Campestre Guaymaral in Bogota…His winning total on that second career win was 280 (-8)…Finished T44 at the Puerto Rico Open on his career start on the PGA TOUR…Missed the cut on both of his starts on the Web.com Tour…Finished T11 at the Club Colombia Masters, an event co-sanctioned by the Tour de las Americas and the European Challenge Tour…His best finish in two European Tour starts was T32 at the JBWere Masters.

2008: Made his professional debut with a victory at the Colombian Open on August 3, 2008… Won that tournament by two strokes at 8-under par 272 at the Club Los Lagartos in Bogota…Considers that victory as his biggest thrill in golf.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: As an amateur and while at the University of Florida he claimed top individual honors at the SunTrust Gator Invitational during the 2006-07 season…From 1998-02, he finished in the top-10 in 40 National Open tournaments in Colombia, taking top honors in nine of those events…Took second at the 1999 South America Amateur in Asuncion, Paraguay…In his early teens won two National Championships in Colombia: Boys 12-14 in 1998 and Boys 10-12 in 1996.
tourBios.personal: His older brother Camilo is a three-time PGA TOUR champion…His father was a trial Pan American Championship runner-up…Names Rogelio González as his golf instructor…Loves music and never travels without a pillow and his tennis rackets…Does not like white tees and never cuts his nails during a tournament…Considers himself a huge sports fan, with the Atlético Nacional de Medellin from the Colombian football (soccer) league as his favorite professional team…His favorite movie is Shawshank Redemption and his favorite book Open by Andre Agassi…Loves Peruvian food and sea food in general… Doing bungee jumping is high on his bucket list…His favorite quote: “Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.”…Favorite charity is Circo Momo Foundation from Medellin...Twitter name is @Mvillegas03.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Top-75 Money Winner from 2014 Web.com Tour Regular Season
tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts. Best finish was a T18 at the Utah Championship in August.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played in 22 Web.com Tour events, making 12 cuts. Had one top-10 and five top-25s. Finished the Regular Season 52nd in earnings...Opened the year with finishes of T14, T34, 4th and T11...The 4th came at the Brasil Champions, where he carded 67-66-67-66. His 18-under 266 resulted in a career-best finish and propelled him to No. 8 on the money list...Was T2 and one off the lead after rounds of 73-67-64 at the Chile Classic in March. Shot 76 Sunday to finish T34...Had two more top-25s in May in Raleigh (T22) and July in Nova Scotia (T23)...Had disappointing Web.com Tour Finals, with his only cut made, a T38, at the Chiquita Classic...Was 6th in Sand Save Percentage (61.11)...Made two PGA TOUR Latinoamérica appearances, with a T13 at the Lexus Peru Open his best showing.

2013: Made the cut in four of five Web.com Tour starts. Received a sponsor exemption into the Colombia Championship in Bogota, where he birdied three of his final five holes Sunday for a 3-under 68 to T7...Strong showing in his native country earned him a start the following week, at the Chile Classic in Santiago...Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 5 on the Order of Merit and earned Web.com Tour status for the 2014 season. Collected a victory, three top-three finishes and four top-10 efforts in 14 starts...Won the TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open at Atlas CC in Guadalajara, Mexico in March. Led the event at the halfway point and entered the final round trailing Oscar Serna by one. Made eagle on 15 and birdie on 18 to defeat José de Jesús Rodríguez by one. At the time, the $27,000 check helped him move into the second spot of the Order of Merit. Lost a playoff for the title of the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic in October. Lost to José de Jesús Rodríguez after making a bogey on the second playoff hole in Bogota's San Andrés GC, Held the tournament's 36-hole lead after carding a 64 in the second round and had a chanceto win on the 72nd hole but missed a 5-foot birdie putt to finish tied with Rodríguez at 14-under par...Finished T3 at the Mundo Maya Open in Merida, Mexico, where he held the tournament lead for the first 36 holes in May...Finished T11 at the Puerto Rico Classic, an event he led following an opening-round of 65 in October. Earned his Tour card through a regional exemption awarded to the Colombian Golf Federation. 

2012: In May, he suffered a fracture of his fourth metacarpal in his right hand that keep him off the golf course for three months, a factor that limited his play during the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. Had two top-25 finishes and made six cuts in eight starts to finish 58th on the Order of Merit. His best finish was T14 at the Lexus Peru Open in November. Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica fully exempt status by finishing second in a local qualifier organized by the Colombian Golf Federation in August. His best finish in two Web.com Tour starts was T33 at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship.

2011: Represented Colombia at the 2011 OMEGA Mission Hills World Cup in China, with his brother, Camilo as his partner, with the duo finishing T23. Made two cuts in four Web.com Tour starts, with a T19 finish at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open as his best. Missed the cut at the Puerto Rico Open in his only PGA TOUR start. Had a T38 finish at the European Tour's Iskandar Johor Open.

2010: Made three of 11 cuts on the Web.com Tour. Fired a final-round 67 to wind up solo sixth at the Moonah Classic in Australia...Used a final-day 67 to move up to a T15 finish at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open, in his home country of Colombia...Followed that with a T45 at the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open, where he received a sponsor exemption. 

2009: Held off his countryman and former PGA TOUR member Eduardo Herrera to win the Máster Profesional in Colombia by two shots at the Club Campestre Guaymaral in Bogota…His winning total on that second career win was 280 (-8)… Finished T44 at the Puerto Rico Open on his career start on the PGA TOUR…Missed the cut on both of his starts on the Web.com Tour...Finished T11 at the Club Colombia Masters, an event co-sanctioned by the Tour de las Americas and the European Challenge Tour…His best finish in two European Tour starts was T32 at the JBWere Masters.

2008: Made his professional debut with a victory at the Colombian Open on August 3…Won that tournament by two strokes at 8-under-par 272 at the Club Los Lagartos in Bogota…Considers that victory as his biggest thrill in golf.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: At the University of Florida he claimed top individual honors at the SunTrust Gator Invitational during the 2006-07 season. From 1998-02, he finished in the top-10 in 40 National Open tournaments in Colombia, taking top honors in nine of those events. Took second at the 1999 South America Amateur in Asuncion, Paraguay...In his early teens won two National Championships in Colombia, the boys' 12-14 (1998) and the boys' 10-12 (1996).
tourBios.personal: His older brother, Camilo, is a three-time PGA TOUR champion. His father was a trial Pan American Championship runner-up. Likes music and never travels without a pillow and his tennis racquets...Does not like white tees and never cuts his nails during a tournament...Considers himself a huge sports fan, with the Atlético Nacional de Medellin from the Colombian football (soccer) league his favorite professional team…His favorite movie is "The Shawshank Redemption," and his favorite book is Open by Andre Agassi...Enjoys Peruvian food and seafood in general...Bungee jumping is high on his bucket list. His favorite quote is “Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future. Concentrate the mind on the present moment."...Favorite charity is Circo Momo Foundation from Medellin.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making five cuts. Best finish was a T18 at the Utah Championship in August.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was 4th in 2014 at the Brasil Champions Presented by HSBC.
